intro: Teline microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved teline, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Teline microphylla is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
